nodes.documentation:
Here the renter sets the terms of the rental agreement.
 They initialize with their collateral and set the following variables
 paymentAmount: the cost they wish for rental
 renterCollateral: the amount of collateral they wish for the renter to provide
 rentPeriod: the approximate amount of time for renting (+/- a grace period or two)
 deadline: the time at which the renter must have their item back by
 graceTime: how long will people be given to dispute messages the other party sends to the contract
 as well as time to take the actions required to transfer the item back and forth

Abort the purchase and reclaim the ether.
 Can only be called by the lender before
 the contract is put in motion.
nodes.name: abort

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Not enough remaining time to rent"

arguments.value: Not enough remaining time to rent

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Not enough remaining time to rent"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Not enough funds for payment and collateral"

arguments.value: Not enough funds for payment and collateral

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Not enough funds for payment and collateral"

nodes.documentation: This is how the renter enters the contract
nodes.name: fundAsRenter

nodes.documentation:
Fuzzy Abort
 Works within the grace period of the Renter funding
 Either person can back out during this period
 The period should be used for communication and scheduling
nodes.name: fuzzyAbort

nodes.documentation:
Confirm that you (the lender) will send the item.
 This begins the transfer period which is graceTime in length
nodes.name: Giving

nodes.documentation: Confirm receipt of item within grace period and end grace period
nodes.name: Recieved

nodes.name: confirmReturned

arguments.value: Nice try, buck-o

nodes.name: payLender

arguments.value: Nice try, buck-o

nodes.documentation: This function refunds the renter
nodes.name: refundRenterCollateral
neverReturned

nodes.documentation:
If the lender refuses to initiate takeback of the item
 they can complain to invoke bought rented item dispute
 here, the item is bought, in the eyes of the renter, for the price of renting plus price of collateral
 in the eyes of the lender, it is bought for the price of the renting cost
 This is a bad deal for both with minimal losses
nodes.name: cannotReturn

nodes.documentation:
If the Lender isn't giving the Renter the chance to return
 The Renter is given the option of a scorched earth abort to avoid neverReturned()
 To dissuade malicious use of this, this costs everything from all parties
nodes.name: blameReturn

nodes.documentation:
If the Renter falsely claims they returned
 The Lender is given the option of a scorched earth abort
 To dissuade malicious use of this, this costs everything from all parties
 This needs work, probably
nodes.name: claimFalseReturn

nodes.documentation:
If, after collaterized, the giving process does not go well for the Renter
 Then they are given the option to scorched earth abort
 To dissuade malicious use of this, this costs everything from all parties
nodes.name: blameGive

nodes.documentation:
If the grace period for initial transferring expires and the renter does not signal success or blame
 Then it is likely that the renter didn't respond as they were given chance to both positively and negatively
 Therefore a partial abort is done with payment slashed
nodes.name: cannotGive

nodes.documentation:
If the Lender is truly unresponsive, the Renter has a failsafe with a full refund for them
 and a partial slashing of the Lender
nodes.name: timeOutAfterGive

nodes.documentation:
If the Lender is truly unresponsive, the Renter has a failsafe with a full refund for them
 and a partial slashing of the Lender
nodes.name: timeOutOnGive

Giving().notice: Confirm that you (the lender) will send the item. This begins the transfer period which is graceTime in length

Recieved().notice: Confirm receipt of item within grace period and end grace period

abort().notice: Abort the purchase and reclaim the ether. Can only be called by the lender before the contract is put in motion.

blameGive().notice: If, after collaterized, the giving process does not go well for the Renter Then they are given the option to scorched earth abort To dissuade malicious use of this, this costs everything from all parties

blameReturn().notice: If the Lender isn't giving the Renter the chance to return The Renter is given the option of a scorched earth abort to avoid neverReturned() To dissuade malicious use of this, this costs everything from all parties

cannotGive().notice: If the grace period for initial transferring expires and the renter does not signal success or blame Then it is likely that the renter didn't respond as they were given chance to both positively and negatively Therefore a partial abort is done with payment slashed

cannotReturn().notice: If the lender refuses to initiate takeback of the item they can complain to invoke bought rented item dispute here, the item is bought, in the eyes of the renter, for the price of renting plus price of collateral in the eyes of the lender, it is bought for the price of the renting cost This is a bad deal for both with minimal losses

claimFalseReturn().notice: If the Renter falsely claims they returned The Lender is given the option of a scorched earth abort To dissuade malicious use of this, this costs everything from all parties This needs work, probably

confirmReturned().notice: Confirm that you (the renter) returned the item.

methods.constructor: Here the renter sets the terms of the rental agreement. They initialize with their collateral and set the following variables paymentAmount: the cost they wish for rental renterCollateral: the amount of collateral they wish for the renter to provide rentPeriod: the approximate amount of time for renting (+/- a grace period or two) deadline: the time at which the renter must have their item back by graceTime: how long will people be given to dispute messages the other party sends to the contract as well as time to take the actions required to transfer the item back and forth

fundAsRenter().notice: This is how the renter enters the contract

fuzzyAbort().notice: Fuzzy Abort Works within the grace period of the Renter funding Either person can back out during this period The period should be used for communication and scheduling

neverReturned().notice: ////////////////////////////////////////////////// This section starts the dispute framework /////// ////////////////////////////////////////////////// If an inattentive or dumb malicious renter stops responding The lender is then paid the maximum amount for the item

payLender().notice: This pays and refunds the lender

scheduleReturn().notice: ////////////////////////////////////////////////// //////  This is when the renting happens  //////// ////////////////////////////////////////////////// The Lender schedules a return with one grace period of the deadline This begins the transfer period which is graceTime in length

timeOutAfterGive().notice: If the Lender is truly unresponsive, the Renter has a failsafe with a full refund for them and a partial slashing of the Lender

timeOutOnGive().notice: If the Lender is truly unresponsive, the Renter has a failsafe with a full refund for them and a partial slashing of the Lender
